summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General voluntary interview waiver form, used to inform an employee of their rights and obtain their consent to provide information as part of an investigation. The specific subject of the investigation is heavily redacted, but the form is part of the Epstein-related document set.
keyFacts: The document is a voluntary interview waiver form from the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General.
The form informs an employee that providing information is voluntary and that no disciplinary action will be taken if they choose not to answer.
The employee is warned that any statement furnished may be used as evidence in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
The specific subject of the investigation is redacted in the text, indicated by garbled characters.
The form includes signature lines for a Special Agent, the employee, and a witness, but all names are blank or redacted.
